message.content:
A geyser is a natural hot spring that periodically erupts with a fountain of hot water and steam. 
It is characterized by a tall, narrow column of water that shoots up high into the air. 
Usually, geysers are surrounded by a pool of mineral-rich water and steam that creates a misty atmosphere. 
The color of the water in a geyser can range from blue to green to gray depending on the mineral content. 
The texture of the water can be smooth or bubbling and agitated during an eruption. 
Geysers are typically found in areas with volcanic activity, such as Yellowstone National Park in the United States. 
They are a popular tourist attraction because of their unique and dramatic display of natural power.
